item.title: New hitmarks official release - fading, floating, critical, fonts!
item.dc:creator: @StubernSnake StubernSnake
item.description:
@StubernSnake wrote:

for (int j1 = 0; j1 < 4; j1++) if (((Entity) (obj)).hitsLoopCycle[j1] > loopCycle) { npcScreenPos(((Entity) (obj)), ((Entity) (obj)).height / 2); if (spriteDrawX > -1) { if (j1 == 1) spriteDrawY -= 20; if (j1 == 2) { spriteDrawX -= 15; spriteDrawY -= 10; } if (j1 == 3) { spriteDrawX += 15; spriteDrawY -= 10; } if (!hitmarks) { if (((Entity) (obj)).hitMarkTypes[j1] == 2) { oldGreen.drawSprite(spriteDrawX - 12, spriteDrawY - 13); } else if (((Entity) (obj)).hitMarkTypes[j1] == 1) { oldHit.drawSprite(spriteDrawX - 12, spriteDrawY - 13); } else if (((Entity) (obj)).hitMarkTypes[j1] == 0) { oldBlue.drawSprite(spriteDrawX - 12, spriteDrawY - 13); } else { hitMarks[((Entity) (obj)).hitMarkTypes[j1]] .drawSprite(spriteDrawX - 12, spriteDrawY - 12); } smallText .drawText( 0, String .valueOf(((Entity) (obj)).hitArray[j1]), spriteDrawY + 4, spriteDrawX); smallText .drawText( 0xffffff, String .valueOf(((Entity) (obj)).hitArray[j1]), spriteDrawY + 3, spriteDrawX - 1); } else { hitMarks[((Entity) (obj)).hitMarkTypes[j1]] .drawSprite(spriteDrawX - 10, spriteDrawY - 12); smallText .drawText( 0, String .valueOf(((Entity) (obj)).hitArray[j1]), spriteDrawY + 4, spriteDrawX); smallText .drawText( 0xffffff, String .valueOf(((Entity) (obj)).hitArray[j1]), spriteDrawY + 3, spriteDrawX - 1); if (((Entity) (obj)).hitArray[j1] >= 100) x10Expand.drawSprite(spriteDrawX - 20, spriteDrawY - 13); smallText .drawText( 0, String .valueOf(((Entity) (obj)).hitArray[j1]), spriteDrawY + 4, spriteDrawX); smallText .drawText( 0xffffff, String .valueOf(((Entity) (obj)).hitArray[j1]), spriteDrawY + 3, spriteDrawX - 1); } } } }
This is the cause i replace that ^ with this and it gives 100 errors

for(int j1 = 0; j1 < 4; j1++) if(((Entity) (obj)).hitsLoopCycle[j1] > loopCycle) { npcScreenPos(((Entity) (obj)), ((Entity) (obj)).height / 2); if(spriteDrawX > -1) { switch (j1) { case 1: spriteDrawY += 20; break; case 2: spriteDrawY += 40; break; case 3: spriteDrawY += 60; break; case 4: spriteDrawY += 80; break; case 5: spriteDrawY += 100; break; case 6: spriteDrawY += 120; break; } Entity e = ((Entity) (obj)); if (e.hitmarkMove[j1] > -30) e.hitmarkMove[j1]--; if (e.hitmarkMove[j1] < -26) e.hitmarkTrans[j1] -= 5; hitmarkDraw(String.valueOf(e.hitArray[j1]).length(), e.hitMarkTypes[j1], e.hitIcon[j1], e.hitArray[j1], e.hitmarkMove[j1], e.hitmarkTrans[j1]); } }

Read full topic

item.source: New hitmarks official release - fading, floating, critical, fonts!

item.title: New hitmarks official release - fading, floating, critical, fonts!
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:235, topic:414863”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=516825.msg4038070#msg4038070 date=1341359148]

[im]http://i54.tinypic.com/2mpiys2.png[/im]

I get that, too.

AMG.

I said it a lot, you are calling the hitmask twice.
[/quote]

Sorry, I should have read past the 2nd page :o
I also loaded the font files into my cache and it shows as white blanks. I thought I did it wrong so I deleted the thing and re-did it. That didn’t work. So I made a new file under the name critical_full and still got those white spots. Is my cache corrupt? It also wouldn’t show the hit_full.dat file unless I made a new file called ‘hit_full’ then deleted it.[/quote]

LOL -.- once again this issue has came up a lot and i’ve answered it before.

You must repack them via ‘import’ button in the cache suite

Edit:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:84, topic:414863”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=516825.msg3768821#msg3768821 date=1317497246]
There are hitmark fonts but they are squares/rectangles.
[/quote]

You must repack them. (They should already be packed, but now hit “Import” and pack them again that way)

That happened to me also, it’s completely normal.[/quote]

Narb fridder.

Read full topic
item.source: New hitmarks official release - fading, floating, critical, fonts!

item.title: New hitmarks official release - fading, floating, critical, fonts!
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:232, topic:414863”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=516825.msg4038017#msg4038017 date=1341355724]

[im]http://i54.tinypic.com/2mpiys2.png[/im]

I get that, too.
[/quote]

AMG.

I said it a lot, you are calling the hitmask twice.[/quote]

Sorry, I should have read past the 2nd page :o
I also loaded the font files into my cache and it shows as white blanks. I thought I did it wrong so I deleted the thing and re-did it. That didn’t work. So I made a new file under the name critical_full and still got those white spots. Is my cache corrupt? It also wouldn’t show the hit_full.dat file unless I made a new file called ‘hit_full’ then deleted it.

Double Hitmask Fix:

Remove in NPCHandler: handleHitMask(damg); or it may be handleHitMask(damage);

Remove that and your welcome
